title: Transitioning from Engineer to Manager
summary: Shift your mindset from individual contributor to leader, focusing on enabling others’ success.

details.content: The transition requires letting go of direct technical ownership and embracing responsibility for people, processes, and outcomes.
Instead of writing code, you spend time in one-on-ones, helping team members solve blockers and grow in their roles.

content: Schedule regular one-on-ones with each team member.
Delegate technical tasks to others, focusing on guidance.
Seek feedback from peers and your own manager about your leadership style.
Reflect weekly on your impact as a manager versus as an engineer.

title: Managing Individuals
summary: Support, develop, and motivate each team member to help them reach their potential.

details.content: Individual growth and satisfaction drive team performance and retention.
You notice an engineer is disengaged and, through regular check-ins, discover they want to work on more challenging projects.

content: Hold consistent one-on-ones focused on career development.
Give timely, specific feedback—both positive and constructive.
Understand each person’s strengths, goals, and motivations.
Advocate for growth opportunities tailored to individual interests.

title: Managing a Team
summary: Foster collaboration, set clear goals, and build a healthy team culture.

details.content: A cohesive team delivers better results and creates a positive work environment.
You facilitate a retrospective to address communication issues, leading to improved team dynamics.

content: Set clear, shared goals and expectations.
Encourage open communication and psychological safety.
Celebrate team achievements and learn from failures together.
Regularly assess and address team health and morale.

title: Managing Multiple Teams
summary: Coordinate across teams, align on strategy, and ensure effective collaboration.

details.content: Managing multiple teams requires balancing priorities and resolving cross-team dependencies.
You organize a cross-team planning session to synchronize project timelines and resource allocation.

content: Establish regular syncs between team leads.
Communicate organizational priorities clearly.
Identify and resolve inter-team blockers quickly.
Promote knowledge sharing and collaboration across teams.

title: Managing Managers
summary: Lead through other managers by setting direction, coaching, and building a strong management layer.

details.content: Effective management at this level multiplies leadership impact and ensures organizational consistency.
You mentor a new manager on handling performance issues, helping them grow into their role.

content: Hold regular skip-level meetings to stay connected with all layers.
Coach managers on leadership and people development.
Set clear expectations for management responsibilities.
Encourage peer support and learning among managers.

title: Managing a Senior Leadership Role
summary: Shape organizational vision, influence company strategy, and lead through ambiguity.

details.content: Senior leaders set the tone for the organization and drive large-scale impact.
You work with executives to define a new product direction, aligning teams and resources to deliver on the vision.

content: Communicate vision and strategy clearly and frequently.
Build relationships with other senior leaders and stakeholders.
Anticipate and manage organizational change.
Model resilience and adaptability in the face of uncertainty.

title: Mentoring and Coaching
summary: Guide others’ growth by sharing experience, asking questions, and providing support.

details.content: Mentoring and coaching develop future leaders and foster a culture of learning.
You help a team member navigate a challenging project by offering advice and encouraging self-reflection.

content: Listen actively and ask open-ended questions.
Share relevant experiences without prescribing solutions.
Encourage mentees to set and pursue their own goals.
Provide constructive feedback and celebrate progress.
